algorithm_technique: Two pointers to find sequences of enemy forts between friendly forts.
problem_summary_simple: Find the maximum number of enemy forts captured by moving between your own forts.
problem_summary_technical: Use two pointers to scan for sequences of enemy forts (0) between friendly forts (1 or -1).
key_insights: The core idea is to find segments of enemy forts (0s) that are bounded by friendly forts (1s or -1s).
A two-pointer approach efficiently scans the array, identifying potential capture segments.
The distance between two friendly forts, minus one, gives the number of enemy forts captured.
